1.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
1.description: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

2.name: The Spanish Main
2.description: After being wronged by the Caribbean authorities, a Dutch captain turns pirate to wage war.

3.name: The Valley of Decision
3.description: An Irish maid falls for the son of her wealthy boss, though their disapproving fathers and a bitter strike at the steel mill complicates matters.

4.name: Spellbound
4.description: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

5.name: I Know Where I'm Going!
5.description: A young Englishwoman goes to the Hebrides to marry her older, wealthier fiancé. When the weather keeps them separated on different islands, she begins to have second thoughts.

6.name: Brief Encounter
6.description: Meeting a stranger in a railway station, a woman is tempted to cheat on her husband.

7.name: The Lost Weekend
7.description: The desperate life of a chronic alcoholic is followed through a four-day drinking bout.

8.name: Mildred Pierce
8.description: A hard-working mother inches towards disaster as she divorces her husband and starts a successful restaurant business to support her spoiled daughter.

9.name: Pride of the Marines
9.description: Marine hero Al Schmid is blinded in battle and returns home to be rehabilitated. He readjusts to his civilian life with the help of his soon to be wife.

10.name: And Then There Were None
10.description: Seven guests, a newly hired personal secretary and two staff are gathered on an isolated island by an absent host and someone begins killing them off one by one. They work together to determine who the killer is. Could it be one of them?

11.name: Roma città aperta
11.description: During the Nazi occupation of Rome in 1944, the Resistance leader, Giorgio Manfredi, is chased by the Nazis as he seeks refuge and a way to escape.

12.name: Dead of Night
12.description: Architect Walter Craig (Mervyn Johns) senses impending doom as his half-remembered recurring dream turns into reality. The guests at the country house encourage him to stay as they take turns telling supernatural tales.

13.name: My Name Is Julia Ross
13.description: Julia Ross secures employment, through a rather nosy employment agency, with a wealthy widow, Mrs. Hughes, and goes to live at her house. 2 days later, she awakens - in a different house, ...                See full summary »

14.name: Leave Her to Heaven
14.description: A writer falls in love with a young socialite and they're soon married. But her obsessive love for him threatens to be the undoing of them both, and everyone else around them.

15.name: Detour
15.description: Chance events trap hitch-hiker Al Roberts in a tightening net of film noir trouble.

16.name: Les enfants du paradis
16.description: The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan and the four men who love her.

17.name: Scarlet Street
17.description: When a man in mid-life crisis befriends a young woman, her venal fiancé persuades her to con him out of the fortune they mistakenly assume he possesses.

18.name: Anchors Aweigh
18.description: Two sailors, one naive, the other experienced in the ways of the world, on liberty in Los Angeles, is the setting for this movie musical.

19.name: Caesar and Cleopatra
19.description: At the height of the Roman Civil War, a young Cleopatra (Vivien Leigh) meets a middle-aged Julius Caesar (Claude Rains), who teaches her how to rule Egypt.

20.name: They Were Expendable
20.description: The PT boat unit Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron Three defends the Philippines from Japanese invasion during World War II.

21.name: State Fair
21.description: The Frake family attends the annual Iowa State Fair; each member of the clan has their own reason for doing so.

22.name: Blithe Spirit
22.description: Charles (Sir Rex Harrison) and his second wife, Ruth (Constance Cummings), are haunted by the spirit of his first wife, Elvira (Kay Hammond). Medium Madame Arcati (Dame Margaret Rutherford) tries to help things out by contacting the ghost.

23.name: Ziegfeld Follies
23.description: The late, great impresario Florenz Ziegfeld Jr. looks down from Heaven and ordains a new revue in his grand old style.

24.name: The Southerner
24.description: The life of the poor Tucker family, that worked as cotton pluggers and decided to get their own ground, but nature is against them.

25.name: The Bells of St. Mary's
25.description: At a big city Catholic school, Father O'Malley and Sister Benedict indulge in friendly rivalry, and succeed in extending the school through the gift of a building.

26.name: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
26.description: Encouraged by her idealistic if luckless father, a bright and imaginative young woman comes of age in a Brooklyn tenement during the early 1900s.

27.name: Conflict
27.description: An engineer trapped in an unhappy marriage murders his wife in the hope of marrying her younger sister.

28.name: House of Dracula
28.description: Count Dracula and the Wolf Man seek cures for their afflictions; a hunchbacked woman, a mad scientist and Frankenstein's Monster have their own troubles.

29.name: The Clock
29.description: In 1945, during a 48-hour leave, a soldier accidentally meets a girl at Pennsylvania Station and spends his leave with her, eventually falling in love with the lovely New Yorker.

30.name: Road to Utopia
30.description: At the turn of the century, Duke and Chester, two vaudeville performers, go to Alaska to make their fortune. On the ship to Skagway, they find a map to a secret gold mine, which had been ...                See full summary »

31.name: A Walk in the Sun
31.description: During WWII, a platoon of American soldiers trudge through the Italian countryside in search of a bridge they have been ordered to blow up, encountering danger and destruction along the way.

32.name: The Body Snatcher
32.description: A ruthless doctor and his young prize student find themselves continually harassed by their murderous supplier of illegal cadavers.

33.name: The Enchanted Cottage
33.description: A homely maid and a scarred ex-GI meet at the cottage where she works and where he was to spend his honeymoon prior to his accident. The two develop a bond and agree to marry, more out of ...                See full summary »

34.name: Brewster's Millions
34.description: In order to inherit $7,000,000, an ex-soldier must spend $1,000,000 in two months' time.

35.name: Fallen Angel
35.description: A slick con man arrives in a small town looking to make some money, but soon gets more than he bargained for.

36.name: Rhapsody in Blue
36.description: George Gershwin is a driven composer whose need to succeed destroys his relationship with singer Julie Adams and socialite Christine Gilbert.

37.name: Christmas in Connecticut
37.description: A food writer who has lied about being the perfect housewife must try to cover her deception when her boss and a returning war hero invite themselves to her home for a traditional family Christmas.

38.name: Week-End at the Waldorf
38.description: The misadventures of a group of diverse guests at the Waldorf Astoria hotel in Manhattan.

39.name: The Woman in Green
39.description: Sherlock Holmes investigates when young women around London turn up murdered, each with a finger severed. Scotland Yard suspects a madman, but Holmes believes the killings to be part of a diabolical plot.

40.name: Wonder Man
40.description: After being murdered by gangsters, an exuberant nightclub entertainer returns as a ghost to persuade his meek twin brother to help bring his killers to justice.

41.name: Captain Kidd
41.description: The unhistorical adventures of pirate Captain Kidd revolve around treasure and treachery.

42.name: Danger Signal
42.description: A very romantic murderer has plans to seduce, marry and kill a beautiful woman for her wealth, but finds her younger sister to be even better prey.

43.name: Escape in the Fog
43.description: A military nurse recovering at an inn from a nervous breakdown keeps having dreams where she sees two men trying to murder a third. When she meets a man who is a federal agent at the inn, ...                See full summary »

44.name: Story of G.I. Joe
44.description: During WW2, Pulitzer prize winner and war correspondent Ernie Pyle joins the army and writes articles about his comrades in his daily columns.

45.name: Les dames du Bois de Boulogne
45.description: A society lady engineers a marriage between her lover and a cabaret dancer who is essentially a prostitute.

47.name: Objective, Burma!
47.description: A platoon of special ops are tasked to parachute into the remote Burmese jungle and destroy a strategic Japanese radar station, but getting out isn't as easy.

48.name: Tarzan and the Amazons
48.description: A group of archaeologists asks Tarzan to help them find an ancient city in a hidden valley of women. He refuses, but Boy is tricked into doing the job. The queen of the women asks Tarzan to help them.

49.name: The Bullfighters
49.description: Bumbling detective Stan Laurel disguises himself as a famous matador in order to hide from the vengeful Richard K. Muldoon, who spent time in prison on Stan's bogus testimony.

50.name: Saratoga Trunk
50.description: An opportunistic Texas gambler and the exiled Creole daughter of an aristocratic family join forces to achieve justice from the society that has ostracized them.
